data.title: The Best Golden State Warriors Centers of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 1K sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best Golden State Warriors Centers of All Time. Current Top 3: Wilt Chamberlain, Nate Thurmond, Andrew ...
data.text:
Ranked By

4.5K votes

1.0K voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Golden State Warriors

Big fan of Golden State basketball? Then check out this list of Golden State Warriors centers. It includes almost every center from throughout Golden State Warriors history, including current centers and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA centers of all time, the best Warriors Cs include Nate Thurmond, Wilt Chamberlain, Joe Carroll, and Danny Fortson.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Golden State Warriors starting Cs and backup Cs are Kevan Looney and James Wiseman.

Who are the best centers in Golden State Warriors history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Warriors big man of all time!

Most divisive: Clyde Lee

Over 1.0K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Golden State Warriors Centers of All Time

Birthplace : Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Nationality : American

Team : Los Angeles Lakers, Golden State Warriors, Philadelphia 76ers, Harlem Globetrotters, San Francisco Warriors

Position : Center

Golden State Warriors: 1959–1965

Beginning his Golden State Warriors career in 1959 as a rookie drafted straight out of college, Wilt Chamberlain quickly made a name for himself as one of the most dominant and influential centers the league has ever seen. With an unparalleled combination of size, strength, and agility, Chamberlain's style of play was characterized by his ability to score at will, both inside and outside the paint, while also being a force on the defensive end. The impact he had on the team was instantly felt, as he clinched a Rookie of the Year award and numerous scoring titles. As a testament to his greatness, Chamberlain still holds records for the highest single-season and career scoring averages and ranks top in the all-time rebounding list.

Birthplace : Akron, Ohio

Position : Power forward, Center

Golden State Warriors: 1963–1974

Regarded as one of the NBA's all-time greatest centers, Nate Thurmond was drafted by the Golden State Warriors in 1963 and immediately made his presence felt with his tenacious rebounding and shot-blocking prowess. Known for his relentless work ethic and exceptional defensive skills, Thurmond earned numerous All-Star and All-Defensive Team selections during his time with the Warriors. In 1967, he etched his name in NBA history by becoming the first player to record an official quadruple-double. Though he never won an NBA championship with the Warriors, his contributions to the team are fondly remembered, and his number 42 jersey proudly hangs from the rafters at the Chase Center.

Birthplace : Endeavour Hills, Australia

Nationality : Australia

Team : Milwaukee Bucks, Golden State Warriors, Dallas Mavericks, Cleveland Cavaliers, Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Center

Golden State Warriors: 2012–2016, 2018–2019

Australian big man Andrew Bogut joined the Golden State Warriors in 2012 via a trade, becoming an integral part of their championship-winning teams in 2015 and 2017. Known for his rim protection, elite passing ability, and unselfish play, Bogut formed a formidable tandem with superstar Stephen Curry on offense, particularly in their devastating pick-and-roll game. His commitment to defense and ability to anchor the team earned him All-NBA Defensive Team selections during his tenure with the Warriors. Bogut's importance to the franchise was evident not only through their championship success but also in the impact he had on their once-maligned defensive identity.

Birthplace : Shreveport, Louisiana

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Center

Golden State Warriors: 1976–1980

Prior to joining the Boston Celtics and becoming a key part of their championship-winning "Big Three," Robert Parish was a much-beloved center for the Golden State Warriors between 1976 and 1980. Selected with the 8th overall pick by the Warriors in 1976, Parish quickly established himself as a force in the paint with his elite shot-blocking and rebounding abilities. Known for his smooth, trademark jump shot and imposing defensive presence, Parish earned two NBA All-Star selections during his time with the Warriors. Although he never won a championship in his time with the team, his exceptional play firmly cements him as one of the best centers in Golden State's storied history.

Golden State Warriors: 2015–2022

A vital member of the Warriors' recent championship dynasty, Kevon Looney was drafted by the team in 2015 as a raw but promising young big man. Over time, Looney developed into a defensive anchor and an adept pick-and-roll finisher, playing a crucial role in the Warriors' 2017, 2018, and 2022 NBA championships. His relentless pursuit of loose balls, infectious energy, and unselfish play earned him a reputation as one of the league's most respected role players. Despite his relatively short tenure with the franchise, he is already considered one of the best Golden State Warriors centers of all time.

Birthplace : Flint, Michigan

Nationality : American

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Center

Golden State Warriors: 2016–2018

An athletic marvel and dynamic shot blocker, JaVale McGee made a significant impact during his two-year stint with the Golden State Warriors from 2016 to 2018. Signed as a free agent, McGee added a new dimension to the Warriors' fast-paced offense, thriving as an elite lob target and finisher above the rim. His explosive athleticism and length also translated to the defensive end where he was known for his highlight-reel blocks. Playing an essential role in the Warriors' back-to-back championships in 2017 and 2018, McGee's tenure with the team will be remembered fondly for his energy, excitement, and soaring dunks.
